abstract member SetDefaultContentHeaders : Type * System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpContentHeaders * System.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue -> unit override this.SetDefaultContentHeaders : Type * System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpContentHeaders * System.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue -> unit

Docs.param: The type of the object being serialized. See .
The content headers that should be configured.
The authoritative media type. Can be null.
Docs.summary: Sets the default headers for content that will be formatted using this formatter. This method is called from the constructor. This implementation sets the Content-Type header to the value of if it is not null. If it is null it sets the Content-Type to the default media type of this formatter. If the Content-Type does not specify a charset it will set it using this formatters configured .
Docs.remarks: Subclasses can override this method to set content headers such as Content-Type etc. Subclasses should call the base implementation. Subclasses should treat the passed in (if not null) as the authoritative media type and use that as the Content-Type.
